title: Ticket #2710: Need a way to turn off pss grepping through /proc/pid/smaps
description: The procd (via procapi) reads through every process's /proc/pid/smaps entry on every snapshot. This is very slow. Add a knob REPORT_PSS, defaulting to false to control this.
remarks:
2011-Dec-13 16:02:44 by gthain:
Turns out procd doesn't link with param. I'm just turning this off in the build for now.

2011-Dec-13 16:19:52 by bbockelm:
Any reason why it can't just read from the relevant monitored processes?

When cgroups are enabled, can we just report RSS the same as PSS (as the semantics of RSS from cgroups are a bit closer to PSS)?

2012-Jan-06 19:47:58 by bbockelm:
This seems to be the wrong way to go about this. Why not separate the PSS calculation out of getProcInfo, so this is only called for monitored processes, not all processes on the system?

PSS is very useful and the lack of reliable calculation is hurting CMS at our site right now.
attachments:
• pss_on_demand.patch 3511 bytes added by bbockelm on 2012-Jan-07 19:27:57 UTC.
    The following patch only computes PSS for processes the procd cares about, as opposed to the entire system.
